title.narrative: IDP Response: the provision of hygiene kits, latrines, deep water pump, generators and water pumps

description.narrative: When fighting broke out in the capital city of Juba on the 15th of December 2013, more than 200,000 people fled their homes. Many made shelter in makeshift camps or inside UN compounds with little access to food, water, or sanitation. As a result, the spread of disease became a serious concern. Within less than three weeks over 180,000 people had been displaced across the country. JOAC granted Oxfam GBP 30,000, for the provision of hygiene kits, latrines, deep water pump, generators and water pumps; Christian Aid GBP 30,000 for blankets, cooking utensil and mosquito nets; and Tearfund GBP 30,000 for emergency water, sanitation and non-food items.
